intro: Stylidium alsinoides var. cordifolium, commonly known as the heartleaf stickyweed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its small, showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has a prostrate growth habit with hairy stems and leaves that are typically heart-shaped, giving it its common name. It is often found in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. The species is notable for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and flies due to its nectar-rich flowers.
